```{r}
# Load libraries
library(rvest)
library(readr)
library(dplyr)

# 1️⃣ Scrape the table from Baseball-Reference
url <- "https://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/hof_2025.shtml"
html <- read_html(url)
tables <- html_table(html)

# Usually the first table contains the data
data <- tables[[1]]

# 2️⃣ Set proper column names if first row contains headers
colnames(data) <- data[1, ]  # first row is headers
data <- data[-1, ]            # remove first row

# 3️⃣ Clean column names: trim spaces and replace spaces with _
colnames(data) <- trimws(colnames(data))
colnames(data) <- gsub(" ", "_", colnames(data))

# 4️⃣ Convert numeric columns
# Check actual column names first
colnames(data)

# Usually columns like Ballots, Votes, Needed
numeric_cols <- c("Ballots", "Votes", "Needed")  # adjust names if needed

for (col in numeric_cols) {
  if (col %in% colnames(data)) {
    data[[col]] <- parse_number(as.character(data[[col]]))
  }
}

# 5️⃣ Optional: convert text columns to character
text_cols <- setdiff(colnames(data), numeric_cols)
for (col in text_cols) {
  data[[col]] <- as.character(data[[col]])
}


# 6️⃣ Save the cleaned table as CSV
write_csv(data, "HallOfFame_2025.csv")

# 7️⃣ Check the cleaned data
head(data)
str(data)



```
